info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 04 at 12:53AM EST until February 05 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Transylvania County in North Carolina. * WHEN...Until 1230 PM EST Friday. * IMPACTS...Nuisance to Minor flooding of common, flood-prone areas is likely. Expect impacts to low-water crossings, boat-access areas, low-elevation roadways adjacent to streams, campgrounds, greenways, and parks. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1231 AM EST, Over the past 36 hours, Transylvania County has received 3-6 inches of rainfall due to persistent light to moderate showers. This has caused excessive runoff and significant rises on areas streams. Several streams have exceeded bankfull and are causing scattered nuisance flooding over adjacent low-lying areas. The heaviest rainfall has ended across the region, but another inch of rain is possible through Friday morning. Therefore, it will take several hours for streams to crest and begin their recession. Reaches of the French Broad River, Little River, and Davidson River will not fall back below bankfull levels until later Friday. - The French Broad River in Rosman has reached the Action/Advisory Stage of 7.0 feet and is now exceeding its banks in isolated locations. The river is expected to continue to rise over the next few hours and crest between 7.5 and 8.0 feet before receding into early Friday morning. These elevated levels will cause nuisance flooding of adjacent low-lying farmland from Rosman downstream to Brevard. Shallow flooding of Hannah Ford, Island Ford, and Green roads is likely. The Davidson River near Pisgah Forest is approaching the Action/Advisory Stage of 5.0 feet and will likely exceed bankfull over the next few hours. Expect the Davidson River to crest between 5.0 and 6.0 feet overnight tonight or early Friday morning. These levels will likely cause shallow flooding of Davidson River Rd, Wilson Rd, and Deavor Rd. The Little River near Penrose has exceeded the Action/Advisory Stage of 7.5 feet and is expected to crest around 10.0 feet early Friday morning. At these levels, inundation of 12-18" is occurring in the farmlands adjacent to Cascade Lake Rd and Merrill Ln, with inundation 6-12" deep along Cascade Lake Rd and Merrill Ln. Additional rises are possible so please stay away from all streams and stay weather-aware. - Some locations that may experience nuisance flooding include... Brevard, Rosman, Looking Glass, Gorges State Park, Lake Toxaway, Dupont State Forest, Connestee, Balsam Grove, Penrose, Cedar Mountain, and Sapphire.
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
